snippet: Each side in Syria’s conflict blamed the other Tuesday after multiple blasts rocked Aleppo University, leaving 82 people dead, according to a Syrian official.
abstract: At least two deadly explosions, possibly caused by airstrikes or bombs, devastate campus of Aleppo University in Syria, killing 82 people and wounding 192; opposition and government blame each other for blasts, among worst since Syrian conflict began

byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Reporting was contributed by Hania Mourtada from Beirut, Ellen Barry from Moscow, Neil MacFarquhar from the United Nations, and C. J. Chivers from Antakya, Turkey.

lead_paragraph: Each side in Syria’s conflict blamed the other Tuesday after multiple blasts rocked Aleppo University, leaving 82 people dead, according to a Syrian official.

headline.seo: Dozens Killed as Explosions Hit Syrian University
headline.main: Dozens Killed as Explosions Hit Syrian University
headline.print_headline: Dozens Killed as Explosions Hit Syrian University
